results.title: William Primrose: a violist's legacy
results.creator_credit: KBYU-TV, Brigham Young University and Mark D Collier
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary on Scottish born classical musician, William Primrose, who first studied the violin but very soon changed to the viola and became one of the world’s leading viola players, renowned as a soloist and chamber musician. In this documentary video, recorded at Brigham Young University, William Primrose reminisces about his past with host Dr David Dalton, accompanied by stills, archival footage and additional biographical material from William Primrose’s autobiography, “Walk on the North Side”.

results.title: William Morris Hughes
results.brief_description: The life and political career of William Hughes, Prime Minister of Australia during 1915-1922, shown in contemporary film and stills. Includes film footage of World War I. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: William Faulkner's barn burning
results.creator_credit: Learning in Focus, Calvin Skaggs and Peter Werner
results.brief_description: Based on a William Faulkner story set in the late nineteenth century in which a young boy faces the agonizing decision of whether or not to betray his embittered father, who burns his employer’s barn in an act of revenge. Series hosted by Henry Fonda and stars Tommy Lee Jones.

results.title: William Dobell
results.creator_credit: Collings Productions, Geoffrey Collings and Dahl Collings
results.brief_description: William Dobell has been acclaimed the greatest portrait and character painter of the twentieth century. The film with some 85 examples, reviews and interprets the artist’s work and development from his early days of struggle in London to his success in later times. This review of the work of Dobell includes not only some of his great portraits but also some examples of his early paintings. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: William Delafield Cook interviewed by Deborah Hart...
results.creator_credit: Queensland Art Gallery, Deborah Hart and Ian Stocks
results.brief_description: This video provides a unique opportunity to explore the ideas and works of the Australian born artist William Delafield Cook. Produced in conjunction with the artist’s Retrospective at the Art Gallery of New South Wales, it covers the stylistic development of his art from the 1950’s to the present day. Delafield Cook lives and works both in England and Australia. Widely travelled, his art embodies an exceptionally diverse interest in art history, photography and films.

results.title: William's doll
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films and Roberto Carlo Chiesa
results.brief_description: A young boy finally gets the doll that he has been longing for when his grandfather visits. Intended to show the value of allowing children to grow up without false ideas about masculinity and femininity. Based on the book William’s Doll by Charlotte Zolotow. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: William
results.brief_description: William, too big to be a baby and too small to be one of the boys, finds himself left out of the picnic activities. Left to his own resources he creates a fantasy world with the tiny living creatures. He accidentally becomes the hero of the day and must choose in which world he belongs

results.title: Will you answer true? (NP)
results.brief_description: A companion film to “When I’m calling you”. John Cleese demonstrates an object lesson in how not to handle a sales inquiry on the telephone. Demonstrates eight points of correct telephone sales techniques to turn a general inquiry into a firm order. Narrated by Andrew Sachs. Cast includes John Cleese, Norman Bird, April Walker, Penelope Keith.

results.title: Will the Great Barrier Reef cure Claude Clough
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Richard Mason and John Milson
results.brief_description: A travel film with a difference. Claude Clough, frustrated and depressed, consults a psychiatrist who prescribes a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef. Underwater photography shows some of the dazzling coral formations and reefs and the striking scenery of the reef islands. A satirical fantasy on the theme of a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef.
